comment: same question here... how can transmission delay be more than that of round trip delay? it doesn't make sense to me.... did you find any answer to this question?

Early Ethernet uses CSMA/CD. In CSMA/CD for any station to detect a collision, the Transmission time(The time a station takes to put a packet on the line) must be greater than the time it takes to reach the destination(propagation time)+time it takes for collision signal to reach the station. The maximum of both of these times is propagation delay. So here Transmission time >= RTT(time to propagate packet+collision signal) In this way the station can detect collision while transmitting packet, abort the operation and restart after some time(Back off). Here is a link for a better explanation-https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/collision-detection-csmacd/
